author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government will be reining in spending in the upcoming federal budget, citing concerns with the growth of government spending relative to Canada’s economic growth. Carney told reporters ahead of a cabinet retreat on Sept. 3 that the federal government’s spending had been increasing by an average of 7 percent […]
title: Carney Promises to Rein In Spending as Budget Consultations Wrap Up

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec’s former top public servant has denied being informed in September 2022 that the online platform for the auto insurance board was more than $200 million over budget. Yves Ouellet, former secretary-general of the executive council, testified Wednesday at a public inquiry examining how the online portal known as SAAQclic incurred more than $500 million […]
title: Quebec Auto Board Scandal: Former Top Civil Servant Denies Being Told of Cost Overrun

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: NDP interim leader Don Davies says his party has become too focused on “identity politics” and has lost its ability to resonate with working people in recent years. Davies made the comments on the “The Paikin Podcast” hosted by Steve Paikin  airing Aug. 28, ahead of the party officially kicking off its search for a […]
title: NDP Interim Leader Laments Party’s Turn to ‘Identity Politics’ and Away From ‘Working People’

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Fires in California, Funicular Accident in Portugal, Military Exercises in Indonesia

author: Jack Phillips
description: The mayor of the city called for three days of mourning.
title: At Least 15 Dead, 18 Injured After Historic Tram Derails and Crashes in Lisbon

author: Rob Sabo
description: Canada’s Transport and Internal Trade Minister Chrystia Freeland said the deal reflects a pragmatic approach to business ‘on both sides of the border.’
title: WestJet Orders Record 67 New Jets From Boeing With Options for 25 More

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Southern Ontario’s York region has been hit by a string of violent crimes in recent weeks that have claimed the lives of an 11-year-old girl and two men, one of whom was killed in front of his family over the long weekend. York Regional Police Chief Jim MacSween called the rise in violent crimes “concerning” […]
title: York Region Grappling With String of Murders and Home Invasions

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia says strike action by the BC General Employees’ Union has hobbled driver licensing services in Surrey, B.C. The public auto insurer says all appointments at its Guildford location are cancelled today, but drivers can rebook online or visit the company’s other location on 78th Ave. The insurance corporation says […]
title: ICBC Services Hobbled in Surrey, BC, as Government Workers’ Strike Action Continues

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says his government will seek to expand commercial relations with Beijing, given China’s position as Canada’s second-largest trading partner. He adds that any expanded cooperation will be consistent with the values and interests of Canadians. Carney made the comments during a Sept. 3 press conference as a two-day meeting with his […]
title: Ottawa Looking to Expand Trade Cooperation With China in Ways ‘Consistent’ With Canadian Values, Carney Says

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says he had a lengthy conversation with U.S. President Donald Trump earlier this week and that some agreements could be reached on trade. “We expect there could be agreements, small agreements, in a few strategic sectors,” Carney said. “There’s nothing guaranteed but we’re making progress.” Carney commented on the conversation before […]
title: Carney Says He Expects ‘Small Agreements’ After ‘Good’ Call With Trump

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Canadian Coast Guard has been moved under the purview of the Department of National Defence as Ottawa seeks to increase the agency’s role in asserting Canada’s sovereignty. The signing of an Order in Council issued by cabinet on Sept. 2 has officially integrated the Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) into the Department of National Defence […]
title: Canadian Coast Guard Leaves Fisheries to Join Defence Department

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is calling on the federal government to permanently end the temporary foreign worker (TFW) program, saying it has shut young Canadians out of employment and allowed some businesses to take advantage of newcomers. “It is a very exploitative system that has allowed corporate elites to profit off of driving wages down […]
title: Poilievre Calls on Ottawa to End Temporary Foreign Worker Program

author: Catherine Yang
description: 'These aren't just anti-Western optics: This is a direct challenge to the international system built on rules,' says EU's head of foreign affairs.
title: EU Criticizes Beijing’s Support for War in Ukraine After Xi’s ‘Peace or War’ Comment

author: Chandra Philip
description: New Brunswick’s Horizon Health Network has introduced mandatory masking in patient-facing clinical areas, including emergency rooms due to an increase in respiratory illnesses. The regional health authority said all health-care workers, patients, social visitors, and designated support persons (DSPs) will be required to wear “medical grade” face masks in all patient-facing and clinical areas of […]
title: Mandatory Masking Reinstated for Some New Brunswick Hospitals

author: Eva Fu
description: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) said the conversation adds new urgency for the United States to address forced organ harvesting.
title: Putin, Xi Hot Mic Moment on Organ Transplants Underscores Concerns O ver Organ Harvesting in China

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec’s workplace safety board says Montreal’s transit constables fear for their security and should be better armed. Its recommendation is included in a report the board produced for the public transit agency in response to two complaints about constables’ safety in the network. The report, however, does not say what additional weapons should be given to the constables, who already have access to batons, handcuffs, and pepper-spray. The union representing transit constables says its members should be armed with electroshock weapons, such as Tasers. Montreal’s transit agency has […]
title: Montreal Transit Constables Should Be Better Armed, Says Workplace Safety Board

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A large majority of Canadian university students surveyed in a new study say they can’t safely express their opinion in the classroom without facing negative consequences, particularly those who consider themselves politically moderate, conservative, or very conservative. Only 23.6 percent of the 760 students surveyed from Canadian universities reported being comfortable discussing their views on […]
title: Three-Quarters of Canadian University Students Say They Censor Themselves on Campus: Study

author: The Canadian Press
description: Jean Charest says Canada will eventually thank U.S. President Donald Trump for providing the country with a much-needed economic shakeup. The Quebec premier between 2003 and 2012 told business leaders in Quebec City on Tuesday that Trump is pulling Canada out of its “lethargy” and forcing its leaders to rethink the economy. Charest is now […]
title: Canada Will Thank US President Donald Trump in 20 Years, Former Quebec Premier Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A husband and father of four was shot to death in his Vaughan, Ont., home over the long weekend while trying to protect his family during a violent home invasion. Abdul Aleem Farooqi, 46, was killed during the early morning hours of Aug. 31 after several suspects broke into his home, York Regional Police said […]
title: Ontario Father Killed in Front of Family During Home Invasion: Officials

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Quebec’s government is stopping funds for a proposed Northvolt electric vehicle (EV) battery mega factory in the Montérégie region near Montreal. According to Quebec’s Economy Minister Christine Fréchette, the decision was made after Northvolt Batteries North America didn’t provide an acceptable plan for the Northvolt Six plant, which was scheduled to begin producing batteries next […]
title: Quebec Ends Support for Northvolt’s EV Battery Factory, Loses $270M

author: Owen Evans
description: Father Ted co-creator Graham Linehan, a long outspoken critic on gender ideology, says five armed officers arrested him at Heathrow over three posts on X.
title: Comedian Arrested at Heathrow Airport Over Social Media Posts

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: Under the new law, foreign nationals who engage in homosexual conduct in the Western African nation could face deportation.
title: Burkina Faso Parliament Passes Law Criminalizing Same-Sex Relations

author: Chris Summers
description: A United Nations coordinator said the world cannot afford to forget the people of Afghanistan, whose resilience has been strained by multiple crises.
title: Aftershock Hits Afghanistan as Earthquake Death Toll Reaches 1,400

description: Only 13 percent of citizens turned out for the vote, which replaced professional evaluations with direct elections for federal and state judges.

description: 'The people of Taiwan cherish peace, and Taiwan does not commemorate peace with the barrel of a gun,' Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te said.

description: In a seeming repeat of what happened at the 2024 Pacific Island Forum, mention of Taiwan and 'Chinese influence' appeared, then disappeared.

author: The Associated Press
description: JALALABAD, Afghanistan—The United Nations warned of an exponential rise in casualties from a major earthquake in eastern Afghanistan, as the Taliban said the death toll passed 1,400 on Tuesday, with more than 3,000 people injured. The figures provided by Taliban government spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid were just for the province of Kunar. Sunday night’s powerful 6.0 […]
title: Rescuers Race to Find Afghan Quake Survivors as Death Toll Passes 1,400

description: Among the guests at the parade are Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korea leader Kim Jong Un.

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A majority of British Columbians want the province to reduce the size and cost of the provincial bureaucracy, according to a recent poll from Leger. The poll, released Aug. 29 by the Canadian Taxpayers Federation (CTF), shows an overall trend of British Columbians feeling that government-provided services have not improved while bureaucracy has increased. The […]
title: Majority in B.C. Want Government Bureaucracy Reduced: Poll

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Alberta government has temporarily paused the implementation of its standards on sexually explicit content in school libraries, saying the directive needs revision after Edmonton Public Schools released a book removal list that the province says didn’t reflect the policy’s intended purpose. Education Minister Demetrios Nicolaides made the announcement on Sept. 2, a few days […]
title: Alberta to Revise Standards for Sexual Content in Schools After Edmonton Board Compliance Incident

title: Australia Tightens Sanctions on Kremlin Allies

description: 'Biological reality is: male and female—the essential basis for procreation,' Hanson said.
